See, the Lord Yahweh of hosts, is about to take away from Jerusalem and from Judah\q1 support and staff: the whole supply of bread, and the whole supply of water;
\q1
2: the mighty man, the warrior, the judge, the prophet, the omen reader, the elder;\q1
3:
the captain of fifty, the respected citizen, the counselor, the expert craftsman, and the skillful enchanter.

\q1
4: "I will place mere youths as their leaders, and the young will rule over them.\q1
5:
The people will be oppressed, every one by another, and every one by his neighbor;\q1 the child will insult the elderly, and the degraded will challenge the honorable.


\q1
6:
A man will even take hold of his brother in his father's house\q1 and say, 'You have a coat; be our ruler, and let this ruin be in your hands.'
\q1
7:
On that day he will shout and say,\q1 'I will not be a healer; I have no bread or clothing.
\q1 You will not make me ruler of the people.'"


\q1
8:
For Jerusalem has stumbled, and Judah has fallen,\q1 because their speech and their actions are against Yahweh, defying the eyes of his glory.
\q1
9:
The look on their faces witnesses against them; and they tell of their sin like Sodom; they do not hide it.\q1 Woe to them! For they have completed a catastrophe for themselves.


\q1
10: Tell the righteous person that it will be well, for they will eat the fruit of their deeds.\q1
11: Woe to the wicked! It will go badly for him, for the recompense of his hands will be done to him.\q1
12:
My peopleâ€”children are their oppressors, and women rule over them.\q1 My people, those who guide you lead you astray and confuse the direction of your path.



\q1
13: Yahweh stands up for an accusation; he is standing to accuse the people.\q1
14:
Yahweh will come with judgment against the elders of his people and their leaders:\q1 "You have ruined the vineyard; the plunder from the poor is in your houses.
\q1
15:
Why do you crush my people and grind the faces of the poor?"\q1 This is the declaration of the Lord Yahweh of hosts.


\m
\q1
16:
Yahweh says that because the daughters of Zion are proud,\q1 walk along with their heads high, and flirt with their eyes,
\q1 mincing along as they go and making a tinkling with their feet,
\q1
17:
therefore the Lord will form diseased scabs on the heads of the daughters of Zion, and Yahweh will make them bald.

\q1
18: On that day the Lord will remove their beautiful ankle jewelry, head bands, the crescent ornaments,\q1
19: the ear pendants, the bracelets, and the veils;\q1
20:
the headscarves, the ankle chains, the sashes, and the perfume boxes, and the lucky charms.

\q1
21: He will remove the rings and the nose jewels;\q1
22: the festive robes, the mantles, the veils, and the handbags;\q1
23:
the hand mirrors, the fine linen, the head pieces, and the wraps.

\q1
25: Your men will fall by the sword, and your strong men will fall in war.\q1
26: Jerusalem's gates will lament and mourn; and she will be alone and sit upon the ground.\m
